NAME: Name
TUTORIAL_SLIDE0_DESCRIPTION: I'm a technologically advanced personal assistant, backed by data science and artificial intelligence, to help live happier and be better.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE02_DESCRIPTION: I was built around time-tested principles for conducting a wise, balanced and good life; I combine many popular ideas from Epictetus' maxims to Stephen Covey's habits. I am a computer-based life-system that will help you thrive, enjoy more and even lead and help others
TUTORIAL_SLIDE021_TITLE: Also, I may help you managing manual productivity tools
TUTORIAL_SLIDE021_DESCRIPTION: Like most humans in 2017, you may be using manual productivity tools, such as Google's Calendar, Email, Docs, Tasks, etc. If you do, I may help you accessing, integrating and managing those tools
TUTORIAL_SLIDE03_TITLE: A method and initial idea for a long life yourney
TUTORIAL_SLIDE03_DESCRIPTION: I will summarize here our system through a series of conceptual points to give you an initial idea. However, Luckets is intended to be a long life journey of many daily steps, thinking, planning, collecting data, experimenting, interpreting feedback, learning and continuously improving.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE1_TITLE: 1. Identify everything you want or should care in life.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE1_DESCRIPTION: We are going to consider everything. Everything you care. To do that, I will start by proposing you the areas that most humans like you care about: health, family, your mind, money, friends, work, adventure, etc, plus some specific ones for you. Take your time, it's your life
TUTORIAL_SLIDE11_TITLE: 2. Organize everything you care into Luckets
TUTORIAL_SLIDE11_DESCRIPTION: A 'Lucket', is a specific isolated 'life bucket' that represents one or more of those permanent life areas that you plan to care and improve over time. Our predefined Luckets will be fine most of the time. We may create specifics for you. You want to keep the number manageable; Our model luckets list has 24
TUTORIAL_SLIDE111_DESCRIPTION: When done with point 1 and 2, you will have one lucket for anything you care. So, forget about stuff outside your luckets.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE12_TITLE: 3. Order the luckets to define your priorities
TUTORIAL_SLIDE12_DESCRIPTION: All luckets are important but some will be more important to you when things go wrong or become tragic or too urgent. There a many ways to define priorities, sometimes is obvious, sometimes is a personal choice. I will propose you some initial order and then we will fine tune it to you
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_TITLE: 4. Color code the status of all your luckets
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_DESCRIPTION: Blue is perfection, should stop. Green is pretty good, keep working. Yellow is warning, do something. Red is really bad, do something asap. White is skip or neglect, maybe is ok. Black is tragic, stop everything and do this.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you want to assess the status of your 'Health' lucket. If you feel fit, flexible, thin and nice but you still need to watch out your diet and your gym, put a green. Good job. If you are 5kg overweight, feel tired and having not going to gym recently put a yellow. If you are 20kgs overweight, have knee pain and cannot stop eating ice cream and smoking for breakfast, put a red. I would not use white here, your call, but neglecting your health is a bad strategy. I hope you never put black in this lucket. That is very sad, but may happen, specially is you do not stop that smoking. If you feel like the Dalai Lama going to the Olympics put a blue.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_TITLE: 5. Write activities and goals for the week, month, season, year and beyond
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_DESCRIPTION: Life is about doing things within time frames. Humans on earth like sun or moon based time frames and the week is the best unit of planning. Human life also needs longer perspective, try also to write for month, season, year and 5 years.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3a_TITLE: 6. Size activities using units and patterns
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3a_DESCRIPTION: Sizing is a critical fine art that can only be learnt by experimenting and doing. Luckets uses a simple, but powerful, way to size using units and pattern.'do 1 hour of gym 3 times a week', 'work at office 7 hours a day 5 times a week', etc. This point will take some time to master. I will help.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3a_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3b_TITLE: 7. Day by day, pick from your week list
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3b_DESCRIPTION: Is hard to plan a really meaningful day. Some meetings need to be fixed..., but flexibility allows for better optimization and creativity. You cannot plan inspiration. So, together we will assess the day circumstances, your goals and your moods to decide the best to do that day.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3b_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_TITLE: 8. Day by day, assess your activities within time frames
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_DESCRIPTION: Blue means 'done', green 'in progress', white 'skip or neglect', yellow 'warning, needs a attention', red 'trouble, may not happen', black 'dead, no way to do'
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4b_TITLE: 9. Tell me how love or hate that lucket
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4b_DESCRIPTION: Not all luckets feel the same. Some luckets stress us a lot, some of them relax you, some are in the middle. Use color coded triagles to tell me how you feel about them. Read is hate, Green is 'Ok', Blue is love.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4b_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE5_DESCRIPTION: Humans are cute but complicated. You have feelings that greatly impact your plans. For every lucket assess: general mood, feeling about circumstances, motivation, energy, focus. social need. Color code following the idea.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE5b_DESCRIPTION: This system is not about taking hard decisions and stick to them for a long time. Is about ccontinously re-assesing, thinking, recalculating what is the best. Periodically, every week, or every day, we will re-asses your luckets and adapt to optimize our plan
TUTORIAL_SLIDE6_DESCRIPTION: Based on the historical data I will be collecting about your luckets, activities, feelings and information about your circunstances I will be continously giving you new advice, new ways to improve. We will be a team to rock the long term.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE_LAST_TITLE: Good job. Now, slow down and relax. Continue when your are ready, maybe tomorrow. Cheers.
